docs.lead_paragraph: Week after week, Linda Wilmoth and hundreds of other workers have taken turns picketing outside the truck factory just north of Old Hickory Boulevard, burning cords of wood through a brutal winter. The workers are delighted about the arrival of spring, but they continue to rage against their company, Peterbilt Motors, which locked them out right after Labor Day, warning that it would not let them return to work until they accepted management's contract offer.

headline.main: Lockout at a Truck Plant Enters Seventh Month, and Workers Feel the Pinch

docs.abstract: Lockout at Peterbilt truck plant in Madison, Tenn, enters its seventh month; Peterbilt Motors locked workers out right after Labor Day, warning it would not let workers return until they accepted management's contract offer; union leaders rejected Peterbilt's offer, which included annual raises of less than 2 percent, largely because it sought several givebacks on health insurance; photo (M)
